oai_dc:dc.dc:title: MONTHLY MEAN WAVE HEIGHT FORECASTS USING THE STATISTICAL WAVE MODEL BASED ON PCA ANALYSIS
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Shibutani, Yoko
Mori, Nobuhito
Kanda, Taisei
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Wave forecasts are refed in various fields such as fishing, surfing, ship navigation, and maritime construction. In addition, mild wave conditions are necessary during construction on the sea. Therefore, the accuracy of wave forecasting greatly influences marine construction management. In order to make a construction plan for marine construction, it is desired to estimate the wave height and frequency of construction several months ahead. The concern with long-term predictions has been growing because most wave forecasts are short-term predictions. In this study, a monthly ensemble mean wave height prediction was carried out using the statistical wave model, and the prediction accuracy was verified.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 37 (2022): Proceedings of 37th Conference on Coastal Engineering, Sydney, Australia, 2022; waves.10
